title: id collision in your showcase data. Sample app crashes
body:
`FATAL EXCEPTION: main
                                                                   Process: com.airbnb.lottie, PID: 28102
                                                                   java.lang.IllegalStateException: Two models have the same ID. ID's must be unique! Model at position 41: ShowcaseAnimationItemViewModel_{previewUrl_String=http://www.lottiefiles.com/storage/previews/1505.png, onClickListener_OnClickListener=com.airbnb.lottie.samples.ShowcaseFragment$buildModels$$inlined$forEach$lambda$1@755e7d, title_StringAttributeData=com.airbnb.epoxy.StringAttributeData@d0154e9c}ShowcaseAnimationItemViewModel_{id=2900301972622822705, viewType=0, shown=true, addedToAdapter=true} Model at position 40: ShowcaseAnimationItemViewModel_{previewUrl_String=http://www.lottiefiles.com/storage/previews/1503.png, onClickListener_OnClickListener=com.airbnb.lottie.samples.ShowcaseFragment$buildModels$$inlined$forEach$lambda$1@6718172, title_StringAttributeData=com.airbnb.epoxy.StringAttributeData@d0154e9c}ShowcaseAnimationItemViewModel_{id=2900301972622822705, viewType=0, shown=true, addedToAdapter=true}`

Since i'm completely new to that sample app im not sure weather the data is simply duplicated or the hash really got a collision. But unfortunately it crashes the sample app right at the beginning

a little salt fixed it in no time 

in ShowcaseFragment line 72
.id(it.title + Math.random())
